name: Data Analytics and Information Systems
shortSummary: Introduces data analytics and information systems concepts for accounting. Students explore system components, information quality, data modelling, internal controls, risk, reporting systems, and how technology supports financial and operational decision making.

name: Computerized Accounting
shortSummary: Provides hands on experience with accounting software. Topics include company setup, full cycle accounting, GST and PST, payroll, foreign currency, budgeting, project costing, inventory tracking, and reconciliations so that students can produce accurate system generated financial information.

name: Audit and Assurance
shortSummary: Covers the audit process from planning to reporting. Students learn about internal controls, audit evidence, materiality, risk, independence, ethics, audit data analytics, and how to plan and perform procedures, evaluate controls, assess evidence, and prepare audit documentation and reports.

name: Management Information Systems
shortSummary: Explores how organizations use information systems to support decisions, improve operations, enhance security, and strengthen performance. Topics typically include decision support systems, e business, business intelligence, networks, enterprise systems, and emerging tools such as AI.

name: Project Management Essentials
shortSummary: Introduces the concepts, tools, and techniques of project management across the full project life cycle. Students work with scheduling, scope, budgeting, risk management, resource planning, and evaluation, building skills that can also support professional project management certification.

name: Fundamentals of Business
shortSummary: Provides an overview of the Canadian business environment and core business functions. Students examine forms of ownership, management roles, ethics, globalization, and basic ideas from areas such as accounting, marketing, human resources, and operations.

name: Computer Information Systems
shortSummary: Introduces information systems and productivity tools used in business. Students work with hardware and software basics, office and collaboration tools, databases, networks, cloud services, and analytics, while also considering privacy, security, and ethical issues in technology use.

name: Financial Accounting
shortSummary: Covers the accounting cycle and preparation of basic financial statements. Students learn to record transactions, prepare an income statement, statement of financial position, and cash flow statement, and interpret information about assets, liabilities, equity, revenue, and expenses.

name: Organizational Behaviour
shortSummary: Examines individual and group behaviour in organizations. Topics include motivation, leadership, perception, communication, teamwork, decision making, power, conflict, and organizational culture, with an emphasis on applying these ideas to improve workplace performance.

name: Finance 1
shortSummary: Introduces foundational concepts in business finance and financial literacy. Students typically explore the time value of money, simple and compound interest, loans and annuities, basic financial ratios, and how financial information supports personal and organizational decision making.

name: Introduction to Entrepreneurship
shortSummary: Explores entrepreneurial mindset and the early stages of starting a business. Students examine opportunity identification, feasibility analysis, business models, value propositions, creativity, risk management, and the unique challenges faced by small business owners.

name: Principles of Marketing
shortSummary: Introduces core marketing concepts such as customer value, segmentation, targeting, and positioning. Students study consumer behaviour, product, price, place, and promotion decisions, and are introduced to digital marketing and communication strategies.

name: Business Law
shortSummary: Covers legal frameworks that affect businesses. Topics may include contracts, torts, business structures, employment law, intellectual property, and consumer protection, with attention to how legal issues influence decisions in small and larger organizations.

name: Human Resource Management
shortSummary: Introduces the role of human resources in organizations. Students explore staffing, workforce planning, training and development, performance management, compensation, health and safety, and labour relations, with emphasis on fair and compliant HR practices.

name: Strategic Human Resource Planning
shortSummary: Focuses on aligning human resource planning with organizational strategy. Topics can include environmental scanning, HR forecasting, succession management, restructuring, outsourcing, HR metrics, and how HR plans support long term organizational goals.

name: Compensation and Benefits
shortSummary: Examines how organizations design and manage compensation and benefits systems. Students study pay structures, job evaluation, market comparisons, performance based pay, indirect compensation, and equity and transparency in total rewards.

name: Recruitment and Selection
shortSummary: Covers end to end staffing processes, including job analysis, recruitment strategies, screening tools, interviewing, decision making, and employment contracting. The course emphasizes legal compliance, equity, and inclusive practices in hiring and selection.

name: The Business of Hotel Management
shortSummary: Provides an overview of hotel operations from a management perspective. Students examine the role of the general manager, quality standards, legislation, human resources, revenue management, sustainability practices, and recognized hotel management standards.

name: Food and Beverage Management
shortSummary: Examines how food and beverage operations are planned and controlled. Topics include menu design and costing, internal controls, purchasing and inventory, marketing, legal and safety requirements, and service management aimed at profitability and guest satisfaction.

name: Principles of Microeconomics
shortSummary: Introduces microeconomic concepts such as supply and demand, elasticity, consumer and producer behaviour, market structures, market failures, externalities, and the role of government in markets.

name: Principles of Macroeconomics
shortSummary: Covers macroeconomic indicators and policies. Students examine GDP, unemployment, inflation, monetary and fiscal policy, international trade, and factors that influence economic growth.

name: Business Statistics
shortSummary: Introduces descriptive statistics, probability, sampling, and hypothesis testing for business applications. Students learn how to summarize data, interpret statistical results, and use basic regression and forecasting tools to support decisions.

name: Writing and Communication
shortSummary: Develops academic and professional writing and oral communication skills. Emphasizes clarity, organization, use of sources, and audience appropriate tone for college assignments and workplace documents.

name: Finite Mathematics
shortSummary: Introduces selected topics from finite mathematics used in business and the social sciences. Students may work with linear equations, matrices, linear programming, and the mathematics of finance.
